buildup.text: The Chinese invented the magnetic compass around the 11th century for navigation.

discovery.text: A compass needle is a tiny magnet that aligns with Earth's magnetic field lines.

twist.text: Earth's magnetic north pole is actually a magnetic south pole â€” opposites attract the needle's north end.

climax.text: Magnetic north drifts about 55 km per year. Right now it's moving rapidly from Canada toward Siberia.

punchline.text: Your compass's north points to Earth's magnetic south pole. Naming is confusing.
